title: UN General Assembly overwhelmingly demands Gaza ceasefire, further isolating Israel and US
description: Palestinian envoy calls non-binding resolution 'historic'. Ten countries voted against, including Israel and US.

title: France's unicorn start-up Mistral AI embodies its artificial intelligence hopes
description: With prestigious researchers, strong political backing and €385 million in raised funds, this open-source start-up aims to develop language processing models capable of rivaling OpenAI, Google and Meta.

title: UK MPs vote for the government's Rwanda migrant bill
description: With 313 votes for the Safety of Rwanda (Asylum and Immigration) Bill to 269 against, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's latest efforts to drastically cut both regular and irregular migration to the UK, in part by deporting asylum seekers to Rwanda

title: Award-winning young French actor investigated for murder
description: Dylan Robert, the 23-year-old winner of Most Promising Actor for 'Sheherazade' at the 2019 Cannes Film Festival, is under investigation for 'murder' linked to clashes between rival Marseille drug gangs.

title: How Russian intelligence services have taken over Wagner's operations in Africa
description: An investigation reveals the names and photographs of the new Russian officials responsible for coordinating Moscow's mission in Mali, the Central African Republic and Burkina Faso.

title: Polish far-right MP snuffs out Hanukkah menorah with fire extinguisher
description: MP Grzegorz Braun doused a menorah lit in the Polish parliament lobby, disturbing parliament on the same day as newly elected prime minister Donald Tusk made his inaugural speech to lawmakers.

title: Egyptian presidential election: The regime's push to mobilize voters
description: Since Sunday and until Tuesday, 67 million voters have been called to vote in an election that should lead to the unsurprising re-election of Abdel Fattah el-Sissi. The main uncertainty of this week's vote will be its turnout.

title: France's defender of rights: 'The immigration bill threatens the fundamental rights of foreigners'
description: Claire Hédon writes that Emmanuel Macron's immigration bill, which was rejected by the Assemblée Nationale on Monday, would on flout the dignity and equality of foreigners in France.

title: NBA: Wembanyama and the Spurs keep losing as basketball star still on learning curve
description: The San Antonio Spurs suffered their 17th defeat in a row against Houston on Monday, setting a new record for the Texan franchise in last place in the Western Conference.

title: Germany charges 27 far-right 'terror group' members over coup plot
description: The 26 self-identified 'Citizens of the Reich' and one accomplice were all charged with 'treasonous' plans to attack the Bundestag, overthrow the government, 'build a new German army' and review the 'new state order' with Russian officials.

title: Harvard president to stay on after anti-Semitism probe backlash
description: Dr. Claudine Gay will retain her position at Harvard, following comments by her and two of her peers at a congressional hearing on anti-Semitism which have already prompted UPenn president Elizabeth Magill to resign.

title: EU awards Mahsa Amini top rights prize as Iran blocks family from attending
description: Amini's mother, father and brother missed the ceremony at the parliament in Strasbourg after authorities confiscated their passports and barred them from flying to collect the Sakharov Prize.

title: Berlin-Paris night train completes maiden trip
description: The 14-hour overnight connection from the German to the French capital will run three times a week, and is scheduled to become daily from October next year.

title: Tusk's return as PM sends populists back to opposition in Poland
description: The former president of the European Council was appointed prime minister on Monday. His government faces the difficult task of unraveling eight years of Polish populism.

title: The day the French government's immigration bill was defeated
description: How opposition groups ended up joining forces to reject the government's controversial immigration bill in the Assemblée Nationale on Monday.

title: French immigration bill: Lessons from a humiliating defeat
description: MPs from the left, the right and the far right united to reject the government's controversial bill, highlighting once again Macron's vulnerability without a majority in the Assemblée Nationale.

title: France's Assemblée rejects Macron's immigration bill: What happens now?
description: The government could choose to let its controversial text continue its journey through Parliament, either in the Sénat or in a joint committee. It could also decide to drop it.

title: COP28 runs overtime as fury mounts over fossil fuels
description: At-risk nations voiced fury over a proposed compromise that stopped short of phasing out fossil fuels, as talks remain nowhere near completion on Tuesday.

title: Emmanuel Macron on the move at COP28
description: The French president was never going to miss a photo opportunity with the heads of state gathered in Dubai for the UN Climate Change Conference.

title: Yemen Houthi rebels claim missile attack on Norway-flagged tanker
description: The assault on the Norwegian ship Strinda in the Red Sea expands a campaign by the Iranian-backed rebels targeting ships close to the Bab el-Mandeb Strait.

title: UN urges leaders to support refugees at global summit
description: Thousands are due to participate in the Global Refugee Forum in Geneva this week, including heads of government and state, in a search for concrete responses to record displacements.

title: Chinese dissident doctor and outspoken AIDS whistleblower dies aged 95
description: Gao Yaojie, who dedicated her retirement to helping AIDS patients and orphans, passed away in New York City on Sunday.

title: Russia enlists Nepalese fighters on the Ukrainian front
description: The Nepalese government has confirmed that at least six mercenaries who went to fight in Ukraine have been killed. The small Himalayan country has asked the Russian government to return the bodies and to stop using its citizens for military purposes.

title: Born Bad record store, Paris' rock'n'roll haven
description: The capital's most famous record store, a treasure trove for rock vinyl, is preparing to celebrate its 25th anniversary. Mark Adolph, the manager and drummer of the edgy band Frustration, has lost none of his enthusiasm for showcasing the diverse world of rock culture.

title: Texas Supreme Court denies woman's abortion request following her departure from the state
description: A pregnant Texas woman whose fetus has a fatal condition left the state to get an abortion elsewhere before the state Supreme Court on Monday rejected her unprecedented challenge of one of the most restrictive bans in the US.

title: Italy: Giorgia Meloni's government speaks out against lab-grown meat
description: Far from being a major issue in Europe, cultured meat has nevertheless successfully made its way into the country's public debate. Italy is the first country in the world to pass a law banning it.

title: COP28: Current draft of final agreement rejects the eventual phase-out of fossil fuels
description: As demanded by oil-producing nations, the working proposal only suggests a 'phasing down' of coal that is not captured by technology and 'limitations' on new drilling. This compromise was deemed unacceptable by many countries of the global South as well as the European Union.
